channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The origins of your dog's unique look may be older than you think
item.description: A new study finds that about half of the physical variation seen in modern dogs existed during the Stone Age.
item.content:encoded:
A new study finds that about half of the physical variation seen in modern dogs existed during the Stone Age.

(Image credit: Stephanie Keith)
item.dc:creator: Nathan Rott

item.title: How the turkey trotted its way onto our Thanksgiving tables — and into our lexicon
item.description: Much of the turkey's early history is shrouded in uncertainty, historians and etymologists say — which is particularly true of how the bird got its name.
item.content:encoded:
Much of the turkey's early history is shrouded in uncertainty, historians and etymologists say — which is particularly true of how the bird got its name.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Natalie Escobar

item.title: The U.S. produces a lot of food waste. This place wants to address it
item.description: Even amid rising grocery prices and increased sensitivity to environmental issues, Americans still trash once-edible food at alarming rates.
item.content:encoded:
Even amid rising grocery prices and increased sensitivity to environmental issues, Americans still trash once-edible food at alarming rates.

(Image credit: Keren Carrion)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Pope Leo XIV to visit Turkey and Lebanon on first foreign trip
item.description: Pope Leo XIV is embarking on his first foreign trip, a pilgrimage to Turkey and Lebanon, amid Mideast tensions and the media glare that will document history's first American pope on the road.
item.content:encoded:
Pope Leo XIV is embarking on his first foreign trip, a pilgrimage to Turkey and Lebanon, amid Mideast tensions and the media glare that will document history's first American pope on the road.

(Image credit: Alessandra Tarantino)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Italy now recognizes the crime of femicide and punishes it with life in prison
item.description: Italy's parliament on Tuesday approved a law that punishes femicide with life in prison. The vote coincided with the international day for the elimination of violence against women.
item.content:encoded:
Italy's parliament on Tuesday approved a law that punishes femicide with life in prison. The vote coincided with the international day for the elimination of violence against women.

(Image credit: Roberto Monaldo)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: National Parks to raise fees by $100 for international tourists to popular U.S. parks
item.description: The National Park Service says it is going to start charging international tourists an extra $100 to enter popular parks. They will be left out of fee-free days, reserved for American residents.
item.content:encoded:
The National Park Service says it is going to start charging international tourists an extra $100 to enter popular parks. They will be left out of fee-free days, reserved for American residents.

(Image credit: Ross D. Franklin)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump spares turkeys — but not his political opponents — at annual pardoning ceremony
item.description: President Trump brought grievances to the Thanksgiving pardoning ceremony on Tuesday. He joked about sending the turkeys to a prison in El Salvador, and claimed that last year's turkey pardons were invalid.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump brought grievances to the Thanksgiving pardoning ceremony on Tuesday. He joked about sending the turkeys to a prison in El Salvador, and claimed that last year's turkey pardons were invalid.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Louisiana's top health official, a critic of the COVID vaccine, will be CDC deputy
item.description: Louisiana's surgeon general Dr. Ralph Abraham, who has praised Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s tenure as health secretary and called COVID vaccines "dangerous," will become the second-highest ranking official at the CDC.
item.content:encoded:
Louisiana's surgeon general Dr. Ralph Abraham, who has praised Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s tenure as health secretary and called COVID vaccines "dangerous," will become the second-highest ranking official at the CDC.

(Image credit: Gerald Herbert)
item.dc:creator: Rosemary Westwood

item.title: New limits for rent algorithm that prosecutors say let landlords drive up prices
item.description: Landlords could no longer rely on rent-pricing software to quietly track each other's moves and push rents higher using confidential data, under a settlement between RealPage Inc. and federal prosecutors.
item.content:encoded:
Landlords could no longer rely on rent-pricing software to quietly track each other's moves and push rents higher using confidential data, under a settlement between RealPage Inc. and federal prosecutors.

(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: How a 'sweet and shy' tortoise outlived empires and survived two world wars
item.description: No one knows exactly when Gramma was born. But if the estimated birth year of 1884 is accurate, Chester Arthur occupied the Oval Office and there were only 39 states at the time.
item.content:encoded:
No one knows exactly when Gramma was born. But if the estimated birth year of 1884 is accurate, Chester Arthur occupied the Oval Office and there were only 39 states at the time.

(Image credit: San Diego Zoo/YouTube)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman
